newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuelan tourism up 25 pct in 96 - minister.
newsitem.headline: Venezuelan tourism up 25 pct in 96 - minister.

text.p: More than 750,000 tourists visited Venezuela in 1996, up 25 percent on the previous year, bringing in a record $1 billion in foreign exchange revenue, Tourism Minister Hermann Soriano said Thursday.
"Tourism is now the second largest hard currency earner after oil" in Venezuela, he told reporters on the Caribbean island of Margarita during the inauguration of a new hotel.
Soriano said about one third of total visitors, or about 225,000 people, came to Margarita last year, Venezuela's prime tourist spot.

Venezuela, which has only in recent years started to seriously develop its tourism infrastructure, draws visitors thanks to a combination of Caribbean coastline, Amazonian jungle, Andean mountains and vast plains.
